Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer breached procedural fairness or erred in refusing to reconsider Mr. Naderika's application
Evidence_Assessment: Updated residency documents provided after initial denial
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant to demonstrate grounds for reconsideration
Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires meaningful opportunity for applicants to present evidence; reconsideration is discretionary but should occur if new evidence confirms a material fact
Procedural_Issue: Officer refused reconsideration despite receipt of previously missing documents post-decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach of procedural fairness due to failure to consider submitted documents and deny reconsideration
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to refusal of reconsideration and procedural fairness
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles of procedural fairness
Defendant_Response: Refused reconsideration on basis that documents were not received before decision
Outcome: Case remitted for redetermination by another visa officer
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Missing documents at time of initial decision
